books.title: The Eclogues
books.author: Virgil
books.summary: Ten pastoral poems exploring themes of love, politics, and the impact of war.

books.title: The Master of Ballantrae
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: The relationship of two noble brothers is blighted by hostility and vengeance in Jacobite Scotland.

books.title: Geronimo’s Story of His Life
books.author: Geronimo
books.summary: The Apache war chief Geronimo recounts the story of his life.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: The Tower Treasure
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: After a tower mansion is robbed, two boys are determined to find the culprit and exonerate their friend’s father.

books.title: Leave It to Psmith
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Psmith inveigles himself into Blandings Castle to help out a friend and to pursue love.

books.title: He Who Gets Slapped
books.author: Leonid Andreyev
books.summary: A mysterious gentleman joins a circus troupe as a clown.

books.title: A Princess of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: An adventurer finds himself battling alien civilizations on the strange surface of Mars.

books.title: Pimpernel and Rosemary
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A famous journalist is drawn into the intrigues of two Eastern European nations in the aftermath of World War I.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: A collection of nine short fiction works by influential supernatural and horror author Arthur Machen.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: The Eye of Osiris
books.author: R. Austin Freeman
books.summary: A newly-qualified doctor helps his former teacher, a famed forensic scientist, unravel a case involving ancient Egyptian artifacts, a missing person, and a mysterious will.

books.title: The Humbugs of the World
books.author: P. T. Barnum
books.summary: American archetype and cultural founding father P. T. Barnum shares a collection of anecdotes that he deems “humbugs”—fodder for the gullible, deserving of skepticism—with the goal of making his fellow citizens a little wiser and more skeptical.

books.title: Two Treatises of Government
books.author: John Locke
books.summary: Locke critiques the concepts of absolute monarchy and divine right, arguing instead for a government founded on natural rights, individual freedom, and the consent of the governed, which protects the fundamental rights of life, liberty, and property.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Georgia Douglas Johnson
books.summary: A collection of poems by Georgia Douglas Johnson.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Walter M. Miller Jr.
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Walter M. Miller Jr., ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: Golf Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s golf stories featuring the Oldest Member.

books.title: A Day at a Time
books.author: Archibald Alexander
books.summary: A 1916 Christian devotional reflecting on faith and morality during World War I.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.
